name: Wage rate
description: A measure of the monetary compensation for labor services, typically expressed in terms of a fixed amount per hour, day, month, or other unit of time.

name: Unemployment rate
description: The percentage of the labor force that is unemployed and actively seeking employment. It is calculated as the number of unemployed persons divided by the total labor force.

name: Employed persons
description: Persons above the age of 15 who were in paid employment or self-employment during a specified reference period.

name: Labor force
description: The sum of employed and unemployed persons in an economy, actively participating in the labor market.

name: Unemployed persons
description: Persons of working age who are without work, are currently available for work, and are actively seeking employment.

name: All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), Seasonally adjusted (SA), Index
description: All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. Seasonally adjusted time series are series that have been adjusted for seasonal variations, including trading-day (working-day) effects and other regular calendar variations if present. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time.

name: All Items, Relative consumer price index (CPI), Index
description: All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The CPI of the country compared to the trade-weighted CPI of the country’s trade partners A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time.

name: All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), Index
description: All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time.

name: All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), Not seasonally adjusted (NSA)
description: All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. This term is used to describe data series not subject to the seasonal adjustment process. In other words, the effects of regular, or seasonal, patterns have not been removed from these series.

name: Domestic currency per US dollar, Rate, Period average
description: Domestic Currency per US Dollar refers to the exchange rate between a country's domestic currency and the US dollar. It indicates how much of the domestic currency is needed to buy one US dollar. A measure that expresses the frequency of occurrence of an event or phenomenon in relation to another quantity. This refers to the arithmetic mean (average) value of a data series calculated over a specified period, such as a month, quarter, or year. It provides a representative value for the entire period, smoothing out any short-term fluctuations.

name: US dollar per domestic currency, Rate, Period average
description: Exchange rate indicating how many US dollars are equivalent to one unit of domestic currency. This is the inverse of the "Domestic currency per US dollar" rate. A measure that expresses the frequency of occurrence of an event or phenomenon in relation to another quantity. This refers to the arithmetic mean (average) value of a data series calculated over a specified period, such as a month, quarter, or year. It provides a representative value for the entire period, smoothing out any short-term fluctuations.

name: US dollar per domestic currency, Index Period average
description: Exchange rate indicating how many US dollars are equivalent to one unit of domestic currency. This is the inverse of the "Domestic currency per US dollar" rate. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time. This refers to the arithmetic mean (average) value of a data series calculated over a specified period, such as a month, quarter, or year. It provides a representative value for the entire period, smoothing out any short-term fluctuations.

name: Real effective exchange rate (REER), Index (2010=100) Adjusted by relative consumer prices
description: A real effective exchange rate (REER) is a measure of the value of a currency against a weighted average of several foreign currencies divided by a price deflator or index of costs. The weights are derived by taking a three-year average of the trade partners' combined value of imports and exports with the focal country as a share of the focal countries' total combined value of imports and exports. An increase in REER implies that exports become more expensive and imports become cheaper; therefore, an increase indicates a loss in trade competitiveness. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time. Index is referenced to the year 2010. Weighted index adjusted for inflation differences between the country and its trade partners.

name: Nominal effective exchange rate (NEER), Index (2010=100) Weighted index
description: A nominal effective exchange rate (NEER) is a measure of the value of a currency against a weighted average of several foreign currencies. The weights are derived by taking a three-year average of the trade partners' combined value of imports and exports with the focal country as a share of the focal countries' total combined value of imports and exports. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time. Index is referenced to the year 2010. Weighted average value for a specific variable, reflecting the relative importance of major trade partners.

name: All Items, Relative consumer price index (CPI), Percent Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
description: All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The CPI of the country compared to the trade-weighted CPI of the country’s trade partners A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100. The percentage change over two consecutive years.

name: US dollar per domestic currency, Percent Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
description: Exchange rate indicating how many US dollars are equivalent to one unit of domestic currency. This is the inverse of the "Domestic currency per US dollar" rate. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100. The percentage change over two consecutive years.

name: Real effective exchange rate (REER), Percent (2010=100) Adjusted by relative consumer prices, period average, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
description: A real effective exchange rate (REER) is a measure of the value of a currency against a weighted average of several foreign currencies divided by a price deflator or index of costs. The weights are derived by taking a three-year average of the trade partners' combined value of imports and exports with the focal country as a share of the focal countries' total combined value of imports and exports. An increase in REER implies that exports become more expensive and imports become cheaper; therefore, an increase indicates a loss in trade competitiveness. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100. Index is referenced to the year 2010. Weighted index reflecting major trade partner economies, adjusted by relative consumer prices, period average, Year-over-year (YOY) percent change

name: All Items, Consumer price index (CPI), Percent Year-over-year (YOY) percent change
description: All items in the context of the consumer price index indicates that the index includes prices for all items included in the consumer price index basket.  This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100. The percentage change over two consecutive years.

description: A nominal effective exchange rate (NEER) is a measure of the value of a currency against a weighted average of several foreign currencies. The weights are derived by taking a three-year average of the trade partners' combined value of imports and exports with the focal country as a share of the focal countries' total combined value of imports and exports. This includes prices related to food, beverages, clothing, housing, health, transport, communications, recreation, education, restaurants and hotels and other miscellanoues goods and services. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is an index of the prices of consumption goods and services, as compared to a certain reference period. Seasonally adjusted time series are series that have been adjusted for seasonal variations, including trading-day (working-day) effects and other regular calendar variations if present. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100. The percentage change over two consecutive years.

name: Nominal effective exchange rate (NEER), Index (2010=100) Advanced economy trade partner weighted
description: A nominal effective exchange rate (NEER) is a measure of the value of a currency against a weighted average of several foreign currencies. The weights are derived by taking a three-year average of the trade partners' combined value of imports and exports with the focal country as a share of the focal countries' total combined value of imports and exports. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time. Index is referenced to the year 2010. Weighted average value for a specific variable, reflecting advanced economies trade partners.

name: Real effective exchange rate (REER), Index (2010=100) Adjusted by relative unit labor costs (advanced economies only)
description: A real effective exchange rate (REER) is a measure of the value of a currency against a weighted average of several foreign currencies divided by a price deflator or index of costs. The weights are derived by taking a three-year average of the trade partners' combined value of imports and exports with the focal country as a share of the focal countries' total combined value of imports and exports. An increase in REER implies that exports become more expensive and imports become cheaper; therefore, an increase indicates a loss in trade competitiveness. A statistical measure that expresses the relative change in a variable over time. Index is referenced to the year 2010. Weighted index adjusted for relative changes in labor costs between the country and its trade partners.

name: Capital transfers, Financial corporations, nonfinancial corporations, households, and NPISHs
description: Transfers that involve the transfer of ownership of fixed assets, the forgiveness of liabilities, or the provision of funds linked to the acquisition or disposal of fixed assets. All institutional sectors except the rest of the world.

name: Secondary income, Financial corporations, nonfinancial corporations, households, and NPISHs
description: Secondary incomes are incomes arising from the distribution of income between institutional units via current transfers. In the context of the external accounts, this account records current transfers between residents and non-residents. All institutional sectors except the rest of the world.

name: Other investment, Insurance, pension and standardized guarantee schemes
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Reserves, entitlements, and provisions representing liabilities of the insurer, pension fund, or issuer of standardized guarantees, and a corresponding asset of the policyholders or beneficiaries.

Original contract stipulates that payment is due in more than one year, or has no stated maturity (referred to as long-term maturity)

name: Direct investment, Debt instruments, Rescheduling of payments due in current reporting period, on principal (memo item: o/w exceptional financing)
description: Direct Investment represents cross-border investment associated with a resident in one economy having control or a significant degree of influence on the management of an enterprise that is resident in another economy. Ownership of 10 percent or more of the voting power is evidence of a direct investment relationship.  Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.  Rescheduling of payments due in current reporting period, on principal (memo item: o/w exceptional financing)

description: Direct Investment represents cross-border investment associated with a resident in one economy having control or a significant degree of influence on the management of an enterprise that is resident in another economy. Ownership of 10 percent or more of the voting power is evidence of a direct investment relationship. name: Secondary income
description: Secondary incomes are incomes arising from the distribution of income between institutional units via current transfers. In the context of the external accounts, this account records current transfers between residents and non-residents.

name: Net lending (+) / net borrowing (-)
description: Net lending is the difference between changes in net worth due to saving and capital transfers and net acquisitions of non-financial assets (acquisitions less disposals of non-financial assets, less depreciation). If the amount is negative, it represents net borrowing. In the external accounts, it represents the sum of the balances on the current and capital accounts. This is conceptually  equal to the net balance of the financial account. If the balance is positive, it is called net lending, implying that in net terms, the economy supplies funds to the rest of the world. If the balance is negative, it is called net borrowing, implying that in net terms, the economy receives funds from the rest of the world.

Ownership of 10 percent or more of the voting power is evidence of a direct investment relationship.  Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds.

name: Debt forgiveness (memo item: o/w exceptional financing)
description: The cancellation of debt, noted separately when associated with special financing conditions.

name: Goods sold under merchanting
description: Goods purchased and then sold by a merchant without the goods entering the merchant's country.

name: Portfolio investment, Investment fund shares/units, Money market funds
description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Shares or units in a fund that pools investor money to purchase securities. Investment funds that invest in short-term debt instruments.

name: Other investment, Entitlements to nonpension benefits
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Rights to receive benefits other than pensions, such as healthcare or unemployment benefits.

name: Other investment, Debt instruments (excluding exceptional financing)
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Debt instruments that exclude those related to exceptional financing arrangements.

name: Telecommunications services
description: Telecommunications services

name: Direct investor in direct invesment enterprises, Debt instruments, Investment income on interest and income attributable to policy holders
description: An investor that makes direct investment in enterprises, having control or significant influence. Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.  Interest and income attributable to policy holders

name: Taxes on production and imports
description: Taxes on production and imports

name: Travel services, Both Business and Personal Travel, Other Services, of which education services
description: Travel services, Both Business and Personal Travel, Other Services, of which education services

name: Portfolio investment, Equity, Equity investment associated with debt reduction (memo item: o/w exceptional financing), Non financial corporations, households and NPISH
description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Ownership interest in a company or asset. Equity investments made in the context of reducing or restructuring a country's debt, noted separately when part of special financing arrangements. Includes non-financial corporations, households, and non-profit institutions serving households.

name: Portfolio investment, Equity, Equity investment associated with debt reduction (memo item: o/w exceptional financing), Other sectors than MFIs and general government
description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Ownership interest in a company or asset. Equity investments made in the context of reducing or restructuring a country's debt, noted separately when part of special financing arrangements. Sectors excluding monetary financial institutions and general government.

name: Portfolio investment, Equity, Investment income on dividends and withdrawals from income of quasi corporations (excluding rie and excluding IF)
description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Ownership interest in a company or asset. Dividends and other income distributions from quasi-corporations, excluding those related to reverse investment and investment funds.

name: Direct investment, Investment fund shares/units, Investment income on investment income attributable to shareholders, including income on if, including rie
description: Direct Investment represents cross-border investment associated with a resident in one economy having control or a significant degree of influence on the management of an enterprise that is resident in another economy. Ownership of 10 percent or more of the voting power is evidence of a direct investment relationship.  Shares or units in a fund that pools investor money to purchase securities. Investment income attributable to shareholders, including income on IF, including RIE

name: Other investment, Currency and deposits, Other Sectors (BPM6), Short-term
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Monetary assets held in the form of currency or in deposit accounts with financial institutions. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Other investment, Currency and deposits, Other Sectors (BPM6), Long-term
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Monetary assets held in the form of currency or in deposit accounts with financial institutions. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in more than one year, or has no stated maturity (referred to as long-term maturity)

name: Portfolio investment, Debt securities, Non financial corporations, households and NPISH, Long-term
description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Tradable financial instruments representing a debt, such as bonds and notes. Includes non-financial corporations, households, and non-profit institutions serving households. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in more than one year, or has no stated maturity (referred to as long-term maturity)

name: Goods for processing abroad
description: Goods sent from one country to another for processing and then returned to the original country, recorded in the balance of payments.

description: Reinsurance

name: Reserve assets, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Computer services
description: Services related to the use of computers and information technology, including software development, IT consulting, and hardware maintenance.

name: Other investment, Net incurrence liabilities (adjusted using Fund records), Central bank, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  The net incurrance of liabilities represents the difference between taking on new liabilities less the retirement of liabilities. Country data adjusted using Fund records. The monetary authority of a country responsible for issuing currency and regulating the banking system. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Portfolio investment, Equity and investment fund shares, Non financial corporations, households and NPISH
description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds. Includes non-financial corporations, households, and non-profit institutions serving households.

name: Other investment, Net incurrence liabilities (adjusted using Fund records), Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Other investment, Credit and loans with the IMF: other than reserves, Central bank, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Credit and loans provided by the IMF that are not related to reserve assets. The monetary authority of a country responsible for issuing currency and regulating the banking system. description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government.

name: Direct investment enterprises in direct investor, Debt instruments
description: Enterprises in which direct investment is made by the investor. name: All functional categories, Total financial assets/liabilities

name: Current transfers to NPISH, General government
description: Current transfers directed towards Non-Profit Institutions Serving Households. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments.

name: Direct investment, Investment fund shares/units: reinvestment of earnings
description: Direct Investment represents cross-border investment associated with a resident in one economy having control or a significant degree of influence on the management of an enterprise that is resident in another economy. Ownership of 10 percent or more of the voting power is evidence of a direct investment relationship.  Shares or units in investment funds acquired through the reinvestment of earnings.

name: SDRs holdings, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: SDR Holdings refer to an interest-bearing reserve asset created by the IMF to supplement members’ reserve assets. It is a purely official asset and can only be held and used by members in the SDR department, the IMF, and certain designated official entities. SDR holdings can be exchanged with other members for freely usable currency. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Current taxes on income, wealth, etc. of which: payable by border, seasonal, and other short-term workers (current taxes on income, wealth, etc.), General government
description: Income and wealth taxes specifically related to individuals working across borders on a seasonal or short-term basis. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments.

name: Other investment, Net incurrence liabilities (adjusted using Fund records), General government, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  The net incurrance of liabilities represents the difference between taking on new liabilities less the retirement of liabilities. Country data adjusted using Fund records. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Capital transfers to NPISH, Financial corporations, nonfinancial corporations, households, and NPISHs
description: Capital transfers directed towards Non-Profit Institutions Serving Households, noted separately for accounting clarity. All institutional sectors except the rest of the world.

name: Direct investment between fellow enterprises if ultimate controlling parent is resident, Debt instruments
description: Investment between enterprises controlled by the same parent entity, where the parent entity is a resident of the country. Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.

name: Direct investment between fellow enterprises if ultimate controlling parent is nonresident, Debt instruments
description: Investment between enterprises controlled by the same parent entity, where the parent entity is not a resident of the country. Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.

name: Direct investment between fellow enterprises if ultimate controlling parent is unknown, Debt instruments
description: Investment between enterprises controlled by the same parent entity, where the status of the parent entity's residency is unknown. Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.

name: Other investment, Special Drawing Rights (SDRs): allocations, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  SDR allocations are reserve assets created by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and allocated to its member countries to supplement existing reserve assets. Special Drawing Rights (SDRs) are international reserve assets that the IMF allocates to its members as a form of supplementary liquidity. These allocations are based on each member country's IMF quota and are intended to provide additional liquidity and support to the global financial system. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Other investment, Other debt instruments, Central bank, Adjusted using IMF accounting records

description: Reserve Assets included in SDR basket

name: Direct investment, Investment fund shares/units
description: Direct Investment represents cross-border investment associated with a resident in one economy having control or a significant degree of influence on the management of an enterprise that is resident in another economy. Ownership of 10 percent or more of the voting power is evidence of a direct investment relationship.  Shares or units in a fund that pools investor money to purchase securities.

name: Direct investment enterprises in direct investor, Equity and investment fund shares
description: Enterprises in which direct investment is made by the investor. Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds.

name: Other investment, Debt instruments, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future, including SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, and other accounts receivable/payable. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Other investment, Loans, credit, and loans with the IMF (other than reserves), General government, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Financial instruments including loans, credit, and loans with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), excluding those held as reserves. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Direct investment between fellow enterprises if ultimate controlling parent is unknown, Equity and investment fund shares
description: Investment between enterprises controlled by the same parent entity, where the status of the parent entity's residency is unknown. Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds.

name: Direct investment between fellow enterprises if ultimate controlling parent is resident, Equity and investment fund shares
description: Investment between enterprises controlled by the same parent entity, where the parent entity is a resident of the country. Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds.

name: Direct investment between fellow enterprises if ultimate controlling parent is nonresident, Equity and investment fund shares
description: Investment between enterprises controlled by the same parent entity, where the parent entity is not a resident of the country. Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds.

name: Credit and loans from the IMF: reserve-related liabilities (RRL) to nonresidents
description: Reserve-related liabilities owed to nonresidents arising from credit and loans provided by the IMF.

name: Other investment, Other debt instruments, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Debt instruments not classified under specific categories like bonds or loans. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Other investment, Short-term
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Other investment, Long-term
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Original contract stipulates that payment is due in more than one year, or has no stated maturity (referred to as long-term maturity)

name: Acquisitions (net): nonproduced assets
description: The purchases of nonproduced assets, such as land and natural resources, during the accounting period.

name: Direct investment, Primary income
description: Direct Investment represents cross-border investment associated with a resident in one economy having control or a significant degree of influence on the management of an enterprise that is resident in another economy. Ownership of 10 percent or more of the voting power is evidence of a direct investment relationship.  Primary incomes are incomes earned by institutional units as a consequence of their involvement in processes of production or ownership of assets that may be needed for purposes of production.

name: Financial account balance (assets less liabilities)
description: The financial account balance reflects the difference in transactions in financial assets and liabilities in the accounting period. In the external accounts, only transactions between residents and non-residents are included.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents total
description: The aggregate notional value of all foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector.

name: Debt claims on nonresidents, inter-company lending
description: Claims for debt owed by nonresidents arising from inter-company lending.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Deposit taking corporations, except the Central Bank
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Financial corporations accepting deposits, except for the central bank.

name: Debt liabilities to nonresidents: inter-company lending
description: Liabilities owed to nonresidents arising from inter-company lending.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Central bank
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. The monetary authority of a country responsible for issuing currency and regulating the banking system.

description: Claims for debt owed by nonresidents arising from inter-company lending. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Financial derivatives (other than reserves) and employee stock options
description: Negotiable financial instruments and employee stock options that are linked to other specific financial instruments, indicators, or commodities. Negotiable financial instruments linked to another specific financial instrument, indicator, or commodity, through which specific risks (e.g., interest rate risk, foreign exchange risk, equity and commodity price risk, credit risk) can be traded in their own right in financial markets. Financial derivatives excluding those held as reserves and employee stock options.

name: Other investment, Currency and deposits
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Monetary assets held in the form of currency or in deposit accounts with financial institutions.

name: Other investment, Trade credits and advances
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Financial claims arising from the direct extension of credit by suppliers to buyers for the purchase of goods and services, and advances for work in progress.

name: Other investment, Loans
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Sums of money that are borrowed and expected to be paid back with interest.

name: Reserve assets, Monetary gold
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  Gold held as a reserve asset.

description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  Reserve position in the IMF is the sum of a member’s reserve tranche position and any indebtedness of the IMF in the General Resources Account (GRA) that is readily available to the member to meet balance of payments financing needs. Financial claims arising from the direct extension of credit by suppliers to buyers for the purchase of goods and services, and advances for work in progress. Institutions responsible for controlling a country's monetary policy, primarily central banks.

name: Other investment, Currency and deposits, General government, Short-term
description: Other investment represents a residual investment category that includes positions and transactions other than those included in direct investment, portfolio investment, financial derivatives and employee stock options, and reserve assets.  Monetary assets held in the form of currency or in deposit accounts with financial institutions. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Portfolio investment, Equity and investment fund shares, General government
description: Portfolio investment reflects cross-border transactions and positions involving debt or equity securities, other than those included in direct investment or reserve assets.  Ownership interest in companies (equity) and shares in investment funds. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments.

name: Financial derivatives and employee stock options, Employee stock options
description: Negotiable financial instruments and employee stock options that are linked to other specific financial instruments, indicators, or commodities. Financial instruments granted to employees as part of their compensation package, giving them the right to buy company stock at a predetermined price.

name: Reserve assets, Securities (equity, investment fund shares/units and debt securities)

Financial instruments representing ownership in a company (equity), pooled investments (investment fund shares/units), and borrowings (debt securities) that provide returns to the holder.

description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). name: Reserve assets, Debt securities, Short-term
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Negotiable financial instruments linked to another specific financial instrument, indicator, or commodity, through which specific risks (e.g., interest rate risk, foreign exchange risk, equity and commodity price risk, credit risk) can be traded in their own right in financial markets. Financial instruments whose value is derived from the performance of underlying assets, indexes, or interest rates.

name: Reserve assets, Currency and deposits
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  Monetary assets held in the form of currency or in deposit accounts with financial institutions.

name: Reserve assets, Debt securities
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  Tradable financial instruments representing a debt, such as bonds and notes.

name: Investment income on other investment income
description: Investment income

name: Reserves and Related items
description: Reserves and Related items.

name: Financial account balance, excluding reserves and related items
description: Financial account balance, excluding reserves and related items.

name: Financial account balance (assets less liabilities), Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: The financial account balance reflects the difference in transactions in financial assets and liabilities in the accounting period. In the external accounts, only transactions between residents and non-residents are included. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents total
description: The aggregate notional value of all foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents total
description: The aggregate notional value of all foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents total, Other Sectors (BPM6)
description: The aggregate notional value of all foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Central bank
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. The monetary authority of a country responsible for issuing currency and regulating the banking system.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Other sectors: Other
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Miscellaneous or residual sectors not classified elsewhere.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, General government
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Central bank
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. The monetary authority of a country responsible for issuing currency and regulating the banking system.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents total, Other Sectors (BPM6)
description: The aggregate notional value of all foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Other financial corporations
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Financial corporations not classified under other specific financial sub-sectors.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, General government
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Central, state, and local governments, including their agencies and departments.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Other sectors: Other
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Miscellaneous or residual sectors not classified elsewhere.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Other financial corporations
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Financial corporations not classified under other specific financial sub-sectors.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Deposit taking corporations, except the Central Bank
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Financial corporations accepting deposits, except for the central bank.

name: Foreign currency derivatives by sector notional value of contracts with nonresidents, Deposit taking corporations, except the Central Bank
description: The total notional value of foreign currency derivative contracts with nonresidents, categorized by sector. Financial corporations accepting deposits, except for the central bank.

name: Reserve assets, Currency and deposits, Claims on monetary authorities
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  Monetary assets held in the form of currency or in deposit accounts with financial institutions, claims on monetary authorities.

name: Reserve assets, Currency and deposits, Claims on other entities
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  Monetary assets held in the form of currency or in deposit accounts with financial institutions, claims on other entities.

name: Reserve assets, Reserve position in the IMF
description: External assets that are readily available to and controlled by monetary authorities for meeting balance of payments financing needs, for intervention in exchange markets to affect the currency exchange rate, and for other related purposes (such as maintaining confidence in the currency and the economy, and serving as a basis for foreign borrowing). Reserve assets must be denominated and settled in foreign currency.  Reserve position in the IMF is the sum of a member’s reserve tranche position and any indebtedness of the IMF in the General Resources Account (GRA) that is readily available to the member to meet balance of payments financing needs.

name: Total liabilities, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: The total value of all financial obligations owed by an entity to other entities. These obligations represent claims held by others against the entity and may include loans, debt securities, accounts payable, and other forms of debt. This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Total assets, Adjusted using IMF accounting records
description: Total assets This indicator has been adjusted using IMF accounting records received from the IMF Finance Department.

name: Debt liabilities to nonresidents
description: Liabilities owed to nonresidents in the form of debt.

name: Debt liabilities to nonresidents, Short-term
description: Liabilities owed to nonresidents in the form of debt. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Debt liabilities to nonresidents, Other Sectors (BPM6), Short-term
description: Liabilities owed to nonresidents in the form of debt. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Debt liabilities to nonresidents, Other Sectors (BPM6)
description: Liabilities owed to nonresidents in the form of debt. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government.

name: Debt claims on nonresidents, Other Sectors (BPM6)
description: Claims for debt owed by nonresidents. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government.

name: Debt claims on nonresidents, Other Sectors (BPM6), Short-term
description: Claims for debt owed by nonresidents. Sectors excluding deposit-taking corporations and general government. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Debt claims on nonresidents
description: Claims for debt owed by nonresidents.

name: Debt claims on nonresidents, Short-term
description: Claims for debt owed by nonresidents. Original contract stipulates that payment is due in one year or less or payable on demand (referred to as short-term maturity).

name: Reseve Assets, Not in SDR basket
description: Reserve Assets, not included in the basket of currencies used to value Special Drawing Rights (SDRs).

name: Total
description: The sum of all relevant components or categories.
